Because the weathers hot and your neighbor has pineapple pizza

195708173023

Calling 911 because I'm unsure how to rate my delivery order.

("The companies decide pay and bonuses by ratings. So always 5-star.")

Because the cicadas wont be quiet

193908192023

Calling 911 because no one wants to see Marshall no more.

(Operator: "If you want Shady, then this is what I'll give you." Click, followed by dial-tone.)

Edited August 20, 2023 by 55delta

Because the world hurts you

210908202023
When 911 is a channel number on your TV remote control.

Calling 911 because they can't send over an ambulance because to get to me, it would have to go halfway to me. To do that, it would have to go halfway to halfway. To do that, it would to go halfway to halfway to halfway of that. Continuing as such, it can't get to me.

(Operator: "A centipede makes it without thinking. The ambulance will as well.")

15 hours ago, 55delta said:

Calling 911 because they can't send over an ambulance because to get to me, it would have to go halfway to me. To do that, it would have to go halfway to halfway. To do that, it would to go halfway to halfway to halfway of that.

Halflings. It's always a pain with their travels. Call the eagles instead.

Btw.
Is the Shire main road called Halfway?
Halfway would be a good name for a refueling space station
Calling 911 to get a forum game back on track.
Calling 911 to make their van move the wheel from your top.

Calling 911 because you want the city to turn the lights off.

000908242023
Call 000 or 911 to get a hose

Calling 911 to try to cal 999

205108242023
call 911 or 000 to learn how to light an torch
Calling 911 because SCP-1701 is not a Star Trek reference
Because it adds up to 11 and that is a palindrome.

Because they put bacon on my double bacon cheese burger as i asked for!

202108252023
To tell them the "Do not click this thread" is open.

Calling 911 to tell them to like and subscribe to my channel.

(Operator: "Your shameless plug has earned you a time-out." Click.)
